title: Is Heartseker Ori a legacy skin? Why wasn't it advertised on release.
body:
In 'My Shop' 

http://imgur.com/a/5LLyb

it shows Heart-Ori with the little legacy icon.
However, that confuses me because I know for a fact I would have bought it on release if it was legacy.

Ive just checked the release of it here:
http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/champions-skins/skin-release/loves-true-test

And **nowhere** on that page does it state that it is a legacy skin, or that it will be retired.
And they always do, when releasing limited/legacy skins. So that's obviously why I didn't buy it on the day.


So... is it legacy or not?

If yes: why wasn't it mentioned on release? _(seems totally unfair to Ori players, or skin collectors)_
If no: why does it have a little legacy icon?

Could someone clarify?

replies.body: Pretty sure that Riot announced that all 'Valentine Skins' will only be available during Valentine's Day when Heartseeker Lucian and Quinn came out.

Really? I must have missed this.

thanks for clarifying that!
